module.name: functional_data_and_schematic_representation
module.keywords: module, individual ,class, product, activity, document, organization, person, structure, property, identification, description, intelligent, schematic, representation, process plant

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to record:

ul.li: schematic representation, which is a diagram that presents the classification, structure, properties and identification of products, activities, documents, organisations and people by the relative position of symbols.

purpose.p: A schematic representation may be 'intelligent', which means that the symbols are associated with the things they represent.

li.p: the classification, structure, properties and identification of products, activities, documents, organisations and people;

The structure of products includes both composition and connection relationships. A composition relationship can be either physical or functional. Similarly a functional relationship can be either physical or functional. Types or classes of relationship are defined in a Reference Data Library. The type of a relationship indicates whether it is functional or physical.

example.p: 'Bolted connection' is a class of connection that is physical. The connection between pipe segment 'S12' and the inlet nozzle of vessel 'V4506' is a connection of this class.
'Signal connection' is a class of connection that is functional. The connection between instrument signal line 'i1' and the flow instrument '45-FT-501' is a connection of this class.

note.p: This capability is provided by the referenced Functional_data application module.
This capability is provided by the referenced Schematic_and_symbolization application module.

li.p: associations between symbols on a schematic diagram and the things that the symbols represent.

note.p: This capability is provided by the referenced Schematic_and_symbolization application module.

Application software can use the associations to make the schematic diagram 'intelligent'. This means that a user of the software can select a symbol on the diagram, and thereby obtain further information about the object that is represented.

li.p: the capabilities of application software that processes a schematic diagram.
